definition: lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: This report had an enlightening effect.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道起了振聋发聩的作用。

sentences.english: Thirdly, Zhuangzi' s view about technique makes people now awaken.
sentences.chinese: 第三，庄子对技术的见解令人有振聋发聩之感。

definition: lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
variant of 迴響|回响[hui2 xiang3]
variant of 發人深省|发人深省[fa1 ren2 shen1 xing3]
thousands of horses, all mute (idiom); no-one dares to speak out/an atmosphere of political oppression
(idiom) thought-provoking/to give one food for thought
